second_reading.title: First Letter to the Thessalonians
second_reading.text:
[[1_Th 4,13]]We do not want you to be unaware, brothers and sisters, about those who have fallen asleep, so that you may not grieve like the rest, who have no hope.
[[1_Th 4,14]]For if we believe that Jesus died and rose, so too will God, through Jesus, bring with him those who have fallen asleep.
[[1_Th 4,15]]Indeed, we tell you this, on the word of the Lord, that we who are alive, who are left until the coming of the Lord, will surely not precede those who have fallen asleep.
[[1_Th 4,16]]For the Lord himself, with a word of command, with the voice of an archangel and with the trumpet of God, will come down from heaven, and the dead in Christ will rise first.
[[1_Th 4,17]]Then we who are alive, who are left, will be caught up together with them in the clouds to meet the Lord in the air. Thus we shall always be with the Lord.
[[1_Th 4,18]]Therefore, console one another with these words.

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew
gospel.text:
[[Mt 25,1]]Jesus told his disciples this parable: “The kingdom of heaven will be like ten virgins who took their lamps and went out to meet the bridegroom.
[[Mt 25,2]]Five of them were foolish and five were wise.
[[Mt 25,3]]The foolish ones, when taking their lamps, brought no oil with them,
[[Mt 25,4]]but the wise brought flasks of oil with their lamps.
[[Mt 25,5]]Since the bridegroom was long delayed, they all became drowsy and fell asleep.
[[Mt 25,6]]At midnight, there was a cry, 'Behold, the bridegroom! Come out to meet him!'
[[Mt 25,7]]Then all those virgins got up and trimmed their lamps.
[[Mt 25,8]]The foolish ones said to the wise, 'Give us some of your oil, for our lamps are going out.'
[[Mt 25,9]]But the wise ones replied, 'No, for there may not be enough for us and you. Go instead to the merchants and buy some for yourselves.'
[[Mt 25,10]]While they went off to buy it, the bridegroom came and those who were ready went into the wedding feast with him. Then the door was locked.
[[Mt 25,11]]Afterwards the other virgins came and said, 'Lord, Lord, open the door for us!'
[[Mt 25,12]]But he said in reply, 'Amen, I say to you, I do not know you.'
[[Mt 25,13]]Therefore, stay awake, for you know neither the day nor the hour.”

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 63,2]]O God, you are my God whom I seek; 
for you my flesh pines and my soul thirsts 
like the earth, parched, lifeless and without water.
[[Ps 63,3]]Thus have I gazed toward you in the sanctuary 

to see your power and your glory,
[[Ps 63,4]]for your kindness is a greater good than life; 
my lips shall glorify you.
[[Ps 63,5]]Thus will I bless you while I live; 

lifting up my hands, I will call upon your name.
[[Ps 63,6]]As with the riches of a banquet shall my soul be satisfied, 
and with exultant lips my mouth shall praise you.
[[Ps 63,7]]When I think of you upon my bed, through the night watches I will recall

[[Ps 63,8]]You indeed are my help, 
and in the shadow of your wings I shout for joy.
